pullRequest.body:
Previously the contents of `Morphism/Basic` were all implementation detail that needed to be copied over to each new morphism class. In this PR we clean up the file and promote it into a proper interface of the API. We also phase away from TFAEs in favor of easier to use iff lemmas. We introduce the following two interfaces:

## `IsLocalAtTarget`

- `AlgebraicGeometry.IsLocalAtTarget`: We say that `IsLocalAtTarget P` for
`P : MorphismProperty Scheme` if
1. `P` respects isomorphisms.
2. If `P` holds for `f : X ‚ü∂ Y`, then `P` holds for `f ‚à£_ U` for any open `U` of `Y`.
3. If `P` holds for `f ‚à£_ U` for an open cover `U` of `Y`, then `P` holds for `f`.

For a morphism property `P` local at the target and `f : X ‚ü∂ Y`, we provide these API lemmas:

- `AlgebraicGeometry.IsLocalAtTarget.of_isPullback`:
    `P` is preserved under pullback along open immersions.
- `AlgebraicGeometry.IsLocalAtTarget.restrict`:
    `P f ‚Üí P (f ‚à£_ U)` for an open `U` of `Y`.
- `AlgebraicGeometry.IsLocalAtTarget.iff_of_iSup_eq_top`:
    `P f ‚Üî ‚àÄ i, P (f ‚à£_ U i)` for a family `U i` of open sets covering `Y`.
- `AlgebraicGeometry.IsLocalAtTarget.iff_of_openCover`:
    `P f ‚Üî ‚àÄ i, P (ùí∞.pullbackHom f i)` for `ùí∞ : Y.openCover`.

## `HasAffineProperty`

- `AlgebraicGeometry.HasAffineProperty`:
  `HasAffineProperty P Q` is a type class asserting that `P` is local at the target,
  and over affine schemes, it is equivalent to `Q : AffineTargetMorphismProperty`.

For `HasAffineProperty P Q` and `f : X ‚ü∂ Y`, we provide these API lemmas:

- `AlgebraicGeometry.HasAffineProperty.of_isPullback`:
    `P` is preserved under pullback along open immersions from affine schemes.
- `AlgebraicGeometry.HasAffineProperty.restrict`:
    `P f ‚Üí Q (f ‚à£_ U)` for affine `U` of `Y`.
- `AlgebraicGeometry.HasAffineProperty.iff_of_iSup_eq_top`:
    `P f ‚Üî ‚àÄ i, Q (f ‚à£_ U i)` for a family `U i` of affine open sets covering `Y`.
- `AlgebraicGeometry.HasAffineProperty.iff_of_openCover`:
    `P f ‚Üî ‚àÄ i, P (ùí∞.pullbackHom f i)` for affine open covers `ùí∞` of `Y`.
- `AlgebraicGeometry.HasAffineProperty.stableUnderBaseChange_mk`:
    If `Q` is stable under affine base change, then `P` is stable under arbitrary base change.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

I think I have addressed all the comments. Thanks for the swift review!
Thanks for the swift review!
!bench

Let's wait for the benchmarking to finish. AG is a finicky area currently. 

bors r-
Canceled.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/dace8457-0f00-4e4d-8890-28ce5c2744a8) for commit a67d97bfc51c6f6841ba2b0c2fa9f3e533641ddf.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/3b52f032-0e56-4bb8-8df1-cd620304865b/to/dace8457-0f00-4e4d-8890-28ce5c2744a8) against commit af101290534012f2928c3d6d0d67f0aade6ef428:
```diff
  Benchmark                               Metric         Change
  =============================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Cover.Open   instructions    31.8%
```

Seems minor. I will see if I can track that down later. 

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9991188676/job/27613469511)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9991188676/job/27613469208)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
LGTM, thanks a lot!
I had a look at the big file. Will review the rest tomorrow.
As I said earlier, I really like this change.
LGTM, thanks a lot!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Why did you change this to the set-theoretic version? I liked the old version, because `OpenCover` could be simply replaced by e.g. `EtaleCover` at some point (although the old version was a bit inconsistent, because `restrict` was stated in terms of open sets).

I also like the `OpenCover` version, but because of universe issue, we would need to show `OpenCover.{u} => restrict open => OpenCover.{v}` for both of these conditions.
If you think the `OpenCover` version is better I can change it.
I think I prefer the `OpenCover` version and adding the set-theoretic versions as alternative constructors.
I think this is a very good idea.
I agree that it is more useful to have the equivalences as separate lemmas. Maybe this TFAE is still good as an overview of all characterizations though, but this might also just be a docstring.

Since all of the specialized auxiliary reduction lemmas are removed (which I think is very good), maybe we can add the new code (i.e. `rw [HasAffineProperty.iff_of_openCover (P := @QuasiCompact) ùí∞]`)  for a reduction like this in some docstring as an example for the usage of the `HasAffineProperty` API.
What did come out of this?
I think the newly added docstring of the file is enough?

```suggestion
For a morphism property local at the target, we provide these API lemmas for
morphisms of schemes `f : X ‚ü∂ Y`.
```

```suggestion
  `HasAffineProperty P Q` is a type class asserting that `P` is local at the target, and over affine
```

```suggestion
- `AlgebraicGeometry.HasAffineProperty.iff_of_openCover`:
    `P f ‚Üî ‚àÄ i, Q (ùí∞.pullbackHom f i)` for `ùí∞ : Y.openCover` with affine components..
```

```suggestion
  /-- `P` respects isomorphisms. -/
  respectsIso : P.RespectsIso := by infer_instance
```

```suggestion
1. `P` respects isomorphisms.
2. If `P` holds for `f : X ‚ü∂ Y`, then `P` holds for `f ‚à£_ U` for any open `U` of `Y`.
3. If `P` holds for `f ‚à£_ U` for an open cover `U` of `Y`, then `P` holds for `f`.
```

```suggestion
- `AlgebraicGeometry.IsLocalAtTarget.restrict`:
    `P f ‚Üí P (f ‚à£_ U)` for an open `U` of `Y`.
```

```suggestion
- `AlgebraicGeometry.HasAffineProperty.iff_of_iSup_eq_top`:
    `P f ‚Üî ‚àÄ i, Q (f ‚à£_ U i)` for a family `U i` of affine open sets covering the whole space.
```
In principle I like that the sources of open immersions are `U` and `V` here, but with many open sets flying around at the same time, I find this naming choice confusing.
I changed the names a bit.

```suggestion
#align algebraic_geometry.property_is_local_at_target AlgebraicGeometry.IsLocalAtTarget

namespace IsLocalAtTarget

attribute [instance] respectsIso
```

```suggestion
/-- The restriction of a `MorphismProperty Scheme` to morphisms with affine target. -/
```

```suggestion
#align algebraic_geometry.affine_target_morphism_property AlgebraicGeometry.AffineTargetMorphismProperty

namespace AffineTargetMorphismProperty
```

```suggestion
  respectsIso : P.toProperty.RespectsIso := by infer_instance
```
I don't think this will ever fire so I refrained from adding it.

Could you please add this instance:
```lean
instance {Y : Scheme} [IsAffine Y] (r : Œì(Y, ‚ä§)) : IsAffine (Y ‚à£_·µ§ Y.basicOpen r) :=
  (isAffineOpen_top Y).basicOpen _
```
Then the `@P _ _`.. s here vanish.

```suggestion
  affineProperty_isLocal : Q.IsLocal := by infer_instance
```

I think `isLocal_affineProperty` is the right name according to the naming convention. Also this will never fire in practice so I don't think we should have `:= by infer_instance` as it gives worse error messages.
Out of curiosity: in an earlier version `Q` was not a type parameter, but a field. Why did you change it / why is this better?

Is the `outParam` justified here? It might be reasonable to have multiple `HasAffineProperty P Q` for fixed `P` and varying `Q`. In this case the lemma `of_isLocalAtTarget` below could be an instance as well.

So that by rewriting with API lemmas you get the `AffineTargetMorphismProperty` directly instead of some `MorphismProperty.affineProperty`. But in spirit, it is still a typeclass on `P`, so `Q` should be an `outParam`.

```suggestion
/-- Every property local at the target can be associated with an affine target property.
```

This seems to be a bit off, since `P` is not required to be local at the target in the definition. Maybe this is clearer?
```suggestion
/-- `HasAffineProperty P Q` is a type class asserting that over affine schemes `P` is equivalent to the local `Q : AffineTargetMorphismProperty`. -/
```
I changed the docstring.
I don't think this lemma is necessary, as it can be obtained from `IsLocalAtTarget.restrict`.
Side note: Should this be defined in terms of `IsPullback` mimicking `MorphismProperty.StableUnderBaseChange`?
Can you please move this to `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Cover.Open`?
Since this is not to be used outside this file: Can this be `private`?

```suggestion
theorem stableUnderBaseChange_mk (hQ : Q.StableUnderBaseChange) :
    P.StableUnderBaseChange :=
```
Maybe `stableUnderBaseChange_of` is a better name?
I changed it to `stableUnderBaseChange`.

```suggestion
`HasAffineProperty P Q` is a type class asserting that `P` is local at the target, and over affine
```
I would prefer this to mention `iso` somewhere in the name, maybe `pullbackCoverAffineRefinementObjIso`?

```suggestion
/-- The pullback of the affine refinement is the pullback of the affine cover. -/
def OpenCover.pullbackCoverAffineRefinementObj (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) (ùí∞ : Y.OpenCover) (i) :
    (ùí∞.affineRefinement.openCover.pullbackCover f).obj i ‚âÖ
      ((ùí∞.obj i.1).affineCover.pullbackCover (ùí∞.pullbackHom f i.1)).obj i.2 :=
  pullbackSymmetry _ _ ‚â™‚â´ (pullbackRightPullbackFstIso _ _ _).symm ‚â™‚â´
    pullbackSymmetry _ _ ‚â™‚â´
      asIso (pullback.map _ _ _ _ (pullbackSymmetry _ _).hom (ùüô _) (ùüô _)
        (by simp [pullbackHom]) (by simp))
```
I have been told to avoid tactic mode when constructing data.

```suggestion
theorem HasAffineProperty.diagonal_of_openCover
    (P) {Q} [HasAffineProperty P Q]
    {X Y : Scheme.{u}} (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) (ùí∞ : Scheme.OpenCover.{u} Y) [‚àÄ i, IsAffine (ùí∞.obj i)]
    (hùí∞ : ‚àÄ i, Q.diagonal (ùí∞.pullbackHom f i)) :
    P.diagonal f :=
  HasAffineProperty.diagonal_of_openCover P f ùí∞ (fun _ ‚Ü¶ Scheme.affineCover _)
    (fun _ _ _ ‚Ü¶ hùí∞ _ _ _)
```
Maybe call this one `HasAffineProperty.diagonal_of_openCover` and the more general one above `HasAffineProperty.diagonal_of_openCover_of_openCover`.
Concerning the `affineProperty` bit: Currently it is a bit inconsistent. In the lemma above it does not appear, here and further below it does. I think we can remove it everywhere.
Can you please move this to the `Cover.Open`?
These should go to `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.Shapes.Pullback.CommSq` I think.

```suggestion
theorem HasAffineProperty.affineProperty_diagonal_iff_diagonal
    (P) {Q} [HasAffineProperty P Q] {X Y} {f : X ‚ü∂ Y} [IsAffine Y] :
    Q.diagonal f ‚Üî P.diagonal f := by
```
I think this should be `private` as it should only be used to construct `HasAffineProperty P.diagonal Q.diagonal`.

I think this is not needed as it follows from the `HasAffineProperty` instance below and the general `HasAffineProperty.iff` (if you want you can state the `[HasAffineProperty P Q] : Q = AffineTargetMorphismProperty.of P` separately from the `HasAffineProperty.iff` lemma).

```suggestion
instance HasAffineProperty.diagonal_affineProperty_isLocal
    {Q : AffineTargetMorphismProperty} [Q.IsLocal] :
    Q.diagonal.IsLocal where
  respectsIso := inferInstance
  to_basicOpen {X Y} _ f r hf :=
```
With the newly added global instance, it no longer complains.
I can't comment on unchanged code, but I think that the name of this lemma should be changed to `topologically_isLocalAtTarget`.

Can we also get rid of `LocallyOfFiniteType.affine_openCover_iff` and `LocallyOfFiniteType.source_openCover_iff`? Maybe we can introduce some `HasAffineRingProperty` extending `HasAffineProperty` (this can and should of course go in a follow-up PR).
Yes that's on my plan but probably next PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(AlgebraicGeometry): Rework `Morphisms/Basic` to phase away from TFAEs

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): closed immersions are local at the target

nodes.body: LGTM, thanks a lot!
Thanks for the swift review!
!bench

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Let's wait for the benchmarking to finish. AG is a finicky area currently. 

bors r-
Canceled.

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/dace8457-0f00-4e4d-8890-28ce5c2744a8) for commit a67d97bfc51c6f6841ba2b0c2fa9f3e533641ddf.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/3b52f032-0e56-4bb8-8df1-cd620304865b/to/dace8457-0f00-4e4d-8890-28ce5c2744a8) against commit af101290534012f2928c3d6d0d67f0aade6ef428:
```diff
  Benchmark                               Metric         Change
  =============================================================
- ~Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Cover.Open   instructions    31.8%
```

Seems minor. I will see if I can track that down later. 

bors merge
